ground_truth: Rebecca is handed a bouquet and hurries after the other maids of honor as Suze's father goes to take his daughter's arm. Rebecca turns around and runs into Suze's open arms, grinning happily as she races down the aisle to join the other three bridesmaids who are processing slowly towards the altar. Suze, with her black hair pinned up in an elegant bun, composes herself and looks towards the altar at Tarquin's smiling face. After the wedding, Rebecca and the rest of the guests wave as the newlyweds are driven off in a white Rolls Royce. Rebecca, standing among the well-dressed crowd in her spotted shrug, smiles fondly. As people begin to disperse, her face starts to cloud over, as if suddenly thinking of something sad and serious along with the good things. She turns away from the church and starts walking across a city street in her pink bridesmaid dress, with a heavy tulle petticoat and long, white gloves. She walks past the window of Yves St. Laurent where a black China mannequin knocks on the window. Rebecca lifts the hem of her pink dress and considers, as a second mannequin knocks on the glass and shows her the orange bag she's carrying. Rebecca compares it to her pink one, and the mannequin jiggles the bag seductively. Rebecca's eyes fill with wonder, and she smiles eagerly, but then, with a little shake of the head, she walks on. The two doll-like mannequins look at each other; the seated one with the bag stands up, and both clap their hands. The mannequins in all the fashion windows she passes applaud her, and Rebecca starts to laugh, swinging her skirt joyfully, then stops in her tracks. Luke is standing in front of her in the middle of the pavement. She looks at him like a kid who's been caught stealing sweets and shrugs inanely. She steps towards him, and he steps towards her; they're in front of Asprey's. She shakes her head hopelessly as he looks intently into her face, and a faint smile flickers across his lips. Reaching into his coat pocket, he brings out the green scarf and wraps it around her neck. Rebecca beams at him, and he kisses her on the lips. As they kiss, a pair of ankle boots is placed in a window display, and Rebecca spots them in the corner of her eye as a tall, white-faced mannequin tilts her head and winks at her. Rebecca grins and goes back to giving Luke's kiss her full attention as the screen fades to black, leaving just the green scarf. She introduces Alicia to Janne, who kisses Alicia's hand, and then dances with Luke. Luke spots Graham throwing himself about to the music, where Graham lies on his back and Jane turns his legs like a wheel.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Rebecca is given a floral arrangement and rushes after the other attendants of honor as Suze's father proceeds to take his daughter's arm. Rebecca rotates around and dashes into Suze's open embrace, smiling joyfully as she sprints down the aisle to join the other trio of bridesmaids who are proceeding leisurely towards the altar. Suze, with her ebony hair secured up in an elegant bun, composes herself and gazes towards the altar at Tarquin's beaming face. After the ceremony, Rebecca and the remainder of the guests wave as the newlyweds are chauffeured away in a white Rolls Royce. Rebecca, standing among the stylish crowd in her speckled cover-up, smiles affectionately. As individuals begin to disperse, her expression starts to cloud over, as though suddenly contemplating something sorrowful and grave along with the good things. She turns away from the church and starts strolling across a city street in her pink attendant dress, with a heavy tulle underskirt and long, white gloves. She walks past the window of Yves St. Laurent where a black China mannequin taps on the window. Rebecca lifts the hem of her pink dress and considers, as a second mannequin taps on the glass and displays the orange bag she's bearing. Rebecca compares it to her pink one, and the mannequin wiggles the bag enticingly. Rebecca's eyes fill with amazement, and she smiles eagerly, but then, with a slight shake of the head, she walks on. The two doll-like mannequins glance at each other; the seated one with the bag rises up, and both clap their hands. The mannequins in all the couture windows she passes applaud her, and Rebecca begins to laugh, swinging her skirt gleefully, then halts in her tracks. Luke is standing in front of her in the center of the pavement. She gazes at him like a child who's been caught pilfering sweets and shrugs inanely. She steps towards him, and he steps towards her; they're in front of Asprey's. She shakes her head despairingly as he looks intently into her face, and a faint smile flickers across his lips. Reaching into his coat pocket, he brings out the verdant scarf and wraps it around her neck. Rebecca beams at him, and he kisses her on the lips. As they kiss, a pair of ankle boots is placed in a window display, and Rebecca notices them in the corner of her eye as a tall, white-faced mannequin tilts her head and winks at her. Rebecca grins and returns to giving Luke's kiss her full attention as the screen fades to black, leaving just the verdant scarf. She introduces Alicia to Janne, who kisses Alicia's hand, and then dances with Luke. Luke notices Graham throwing himself about to the music, where Graham lies on his back and Jane rotates his legs like a wheel.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Rebecca is given a bouquet and hurries after the other maids of honor as Suze's father goes to take his daughter's arm. Rebecca turns around and is run into by Suze's open arms, grinning happily as she races down the aisle to join the other three bridesmaids who process slowly towards the altar. Suze, with her black hair pinned up in an elegant bun, composes herself and looks towards the altar at Tarquin's smiling face. After the wedding, Rebecca and the rest of the guests wave as a driver takes the newlyweds off in a white Rolls Royce. Rebecca, standing among the well-dressed crowd in her spotted shrug, smiles fondly. As people begin to disperse, her face is clouded over, as if suddenly thinking of something sad and serious along with the good things. She turns away from the church and starts walking across a city street in her pink bridesmaid dress, with a heavy tulle petticoat and long, white gloves. She walks past the window of Yves St. Laurent where a black China mannequin is knocked on by someone. Rebecca lifts the hem of her pink dress and considers, as another mannequin knocks on the glass and shows her the orange bag she's carrying. Rebecca compares it to her pink one, and the bag is jiggled seductively by the mannequin. Rebecca's eyes fill with wonder, and she smiles eagerly, but then, with a little shake of the head, she walks on. The two doll-like mannequins look at each other; the bag is taken by the seated one as she stands up, and both clap their hands. The mannequins in all the fashion windows she passes applaud her, and Rebecca starts to laugh, swinging her skirt joyfully, then stops in her tracks. Standing in front of her in the middle of the pavement is Luke. She looks at him like a kid who's been caught stealing sweets and shrugs inanely. She steps towards him, and he steps towards her; they're in front of Asprey's. She shakes her head hopelessly as he looks intently into her face, and a faint smile flickers across his lips. Reaching into his coat pocket, he brings out the green scarf and wraps it around her neck. Rebecca beams at him, and he kisses her on the lips. As they kiss, someone places a pair of ankle boots in a window display, and Rebecca spots them in the corner of her eye as a tall, white-faced mannequin tilts her head and winks at her. Rebecca grins and goes back to giving Luke's kiss her full attention as the screen fades to black, leaving just the green scarf. Alicia is introduced by her to Janne, who kisses Alicia's hand, and then Luke dances with her. Luke spots Graham throwing himself about to the music, where he lies on his back and turns his legs like a wheel while Jane watches.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Rebecca receives a bouquet and hurries to join the other bridesmaids as Suze's father takes her arm. Rebecca smiles as she runs to embrace Suze and joins the bridesmaids heading to the altar. Suze, with her hair elegantly pinned, glances at Tarquin's smiling face. After the ceremony, guests wave as the newlyweds leave in a white Rolls Royce. Among the well-dressed crowd, Rebecca stands in her spotted shrug, her smile dimming as she contemplates something serious. She crosses the city street in her pink dress with a tulle petticoat. Passing Yves St. Laurent, a mannequin taps the window, showing an orange bag. Rebecca compares it to her pink one but walks on, shaking her head. The mannequins applaud as she passes, and she laughs, swinging her skirt. She stops when she sees Luke, feeling caught like a child. They step towards each other outside Asprey's. Luke wraps a green scarf around her neck, and they kiss. A wink from a mannequin and a pair of boots catch Rebecca's eye briefly before she focuses back on Luke as the screen fades to black with the green scarf prominent. She introduces Alicia to Janne, who kisses her hand, then dances with Luke. Luke sees Graham dancing wildly with Jane spinning his legs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Rebecca receives a bouquet and rushes with the other maids of honor as Suze's father takes her daughter's arm. Rebecca joins Suze's embrace and races to the aisle, where three bridesmaids slowly process to the altar. Suze, with her hair in an elegant bun, looks at Tarquin's smiling face. After the wedding, guests wave as the newlyweds leave in a white Rolls Royce. Rebecca, in her spotted shrug, smiles but then looks pensive while leaving in a pink dress, petticoat, and long gloves. She passes Yves St. Laurent's window, where a mannequin knocks and shows an orange bag. Rebecca compares it to her pink one, but moves on. Mannequins applaud her, and she laughs, then stops upon seeing Luke. They meet in front of Asprey's, and he gives her a green scarf before kissing her. As they kiss, a mannequin winks at her. The screen fades to black with the green scarf visible. Rebecca introduces Alicia to Janne, who kisses her hand, and then she dances with Luke, noticing Graham dancing wildly as Jane turns his legs like a wheel.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Rebecca, clutching a bouquet tightly in her hands, quickly hurries after the other maids of honor. She rushes forward as Suze's father prepares to take his beloved daughter's arm. In a joyful moment, Rebecca spins around and eagerly rushes into Suze's welcoming embrace, her face lighting up with a broad, happy grin. With joyful energy, she races down the aisle to join the other three bridesmaids, who are gracefully processing in a slow, steady march toward the altar. Suze, adorned with her glossy black hair elegantly pinned up in a refined bun, composes herself with poise. Her gaze drifts toward the altar, where she finds comfort in Tarquin's beaming, smiling face.

Following the wedding ceremony, Rebecca and the rest of the gathered guests enthusiastically wave farewell to the newlyweds. The bride and groom are whisked away in a gleaming white Rolls Royce. Standing among the elegantly dressed crowd, Rebecca fondly smiles in her distinctive spotted shrug. As the people begin to disperse, a contemplative look crosses her face, as if she is suddenly flooded by a wave of both happy and serious thoughts. She turns away from the church, her mind preoccupied, and starts to make her way across a bustling city street. Clad in her pink bridesmaid dress, accentuated by a voluminous tulle petticoat and long, pristine white gloves, she strolls past the window display of Yves St. Laurent. There, a black China mannequin taps on the windowpane with a sound that captures her attention. Rebecca instinctively lifts the hem of her pink dress, pausing to consider this odd occurrence, as a second mannequin raps on the glass, presenting the vibrant orange bag it holds. Rebecca momentarily compares it to her own pink one, and the mannequin wiggles the bag in an enticing manner.

Rebecca's eyes light up with a sense of wonder, and she smiles with excitement, but then, with a thoughtful little shake of her head, she decides to move on. As she continues her walk, the two doll-like mannequins exchange glances; the one seated with the bag suddenly stands, and together, they applaud her departure. In a magical moment, every mannequin in the fashion windows she passes joins in, applauding her with enthusiasm. With laughter bubbling up from within her, Rebecca swings her skirt with joy, only to come to a sudden halt. In the middle of the pavement stands Luke, directly in her path. She looks at him with a guilty expression, reminiscent of a child caught pilfering sweets, and gives a silly shrug. She moves towards him, and he, in turn, steps towards her, bringing them together in front of Asprey's. Rebecca shakes her head in a gesture of hopeless resignation, all while Luke looks deeply into her eyes with a soft, lingering gaze.

As if by magic, Luke reaches into his coat pocket and produces a green scarf, which he tenderly wraps around her neck. The sight brings a beaming smile to Rebecca's face, and Luke leans in to kiss her on the lips. As their lips meet, a pair of ankle boots is carefully placed in a nearby window display. Rebecca catches sight of them from the corner of her eye, as a towering, white-faced mannequin tilts her head and gives her a playful wink. Rebecca grins widely, then returns to savoring Luke's kiss with her full, undivided attention. As the touching scene unfolds, the screen gradually fades to black, leaving the vivid green scarf as the final image remaining. Later, Rebecca introduces Alicia to Janne, who gallantly kisses Alicia's hand before twirling her around in a dance with Luke. Luke's attention is drawn to Graham, who is enthusiastically throwing himself into the music, eventually collapsing onto his back. Meanwhile, Jane spins his legs playfully like a wheel as the joyful celebration continues.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Rebecca, tightly clutching a delicate bouquet of fresh flowers in her hands, hastily scurries after the other maids of honor, her pace quickening with each step she takes. She darts forward eagerly as Suze's father readies himself to lovingly lead his cherished daughter by the arm. In a moment filled with sheer joy, Rebecca spins around with spirited energy and eagerly rushes into Suze's welcoming embrace. Her face is illuminated by a broad, happy grin that radiates her delight. With an abundance of joyful energy, she races down the aisle to join the other three bridesmaids, who are gracefully processing in a slow, steady march toward the altar, maintaining an air of serene elegance. Suze, with her glossy black hair, styled to perfection in an elegantly refined bun, composes herself with innate poise. Her eyes wander gently toward the altar, where she finds a sense of comfort and reassurance in the sight of Tarquin's beaming, smiling face.

After the joyous wedding ceremony concludes, Rebecca, alongside the rest of the gathered guests, enthusiastically waves farewell to the newlyweds with heartfelt appreciation. The bride and groom are whisked away in a gleaming white Rolls Royce, a sight that captures the essence of elegance and celebration. Standing amidst the elegantly dressed crowd, Rebecca fondly smiles in her distinctive spotted shrug, an accessory that adds a personal touch to her attire. As the people begin to gradually disperse, a contemplative look crosses her face, as if she is suddenly overwhelmed by a wave of both happy and serious thoughts flooding her mind. Turning away from the church, her mind preoccupied, she begins to make her way across a bustling city street. Clad in her pink bridesmaid dress, accentuated by a voluminous tulle petticoat and long, pristine white gloves that add a touch of sophistication, she strolls past the window display of Yves St. Laurent. There, a black China mannequin taps on the windowpane with a sound that unexpectedly captures her attention. Rebecca instinctively lifts the hem of her pink dress, pausing for a moment to consider this odd occurrence, as a second mannequin raps insistently on the glass, presenting the vibrant orange bag it holds. Rebecca momentarily compares it to her own pink one, and the mannequin wiggles the bag in an enticing manner, almost as if trying to communicate.

Rebecca's eyes light up with a sense of wonder at the whimsical sight, and she smiles with excitement, but then, with a thoughtful little shake of her head, she decides to move on. As she continues her walk down the street, the two doll-like mannequins exchange knowing glances; the one seated with the bag suddenly stands, and together, they applaud her graceful departure. In a magical moment, every mannequin in the fashion windows she passes joins in the applause, celebrating her presence with enthusiasm. With laughter bubbling up from deep within her, Rebecca swings her skirt with joyful abandon, only to come to a sudden, unexpected halt. Standing right in the middle of the pavement is Luke, directly in her path. She looks at him with a guilty expression, reminiscent of a child caught pilfering sweets, and gives a silly shrug, her demeanor both playful and sincere. She moves toward him, and he, in turn, steps toward her, bringing them together in front of Asprey's window display. Rebecca shakes her head in a gesture of hopeless resignation, all while Luke looks deeply into her eyes with a soft, lingering gaze that conveys his affection.

As if guided by a touch of magic, Luke reaches into his coat pocket and produces a green scarf, which he tenderly wraps around her neck with a loving gesture. The sight brings a beaming smile to Rebecca's face, a reflection of her happiness. Luke then leans in to kiss her on the lips, sealing the moment with affection. As their lips meet, a pair of ankle boots is artfully placed in a nearby window display, catching Rebecca's attention. From the corner of her eye, she notices a towering, white-faced mannequin subtly tilting her head, offering her a playful wink. Rebecca grins widely, then returns to savoring Luke's kiss with her full, undivided attention. As this tender and touching scene unfolds, the screen gradually fades to black, leaving the vivid green scarf as the final image lingering in view. Later, Rebecca takes the opportunity to introduce Alicia to Janne, who gallantly kisses Alicia's hand, demonstrating chivalry, before twirling her around in a lively dance with Luke. Luke's attention is soon drawn to Graham, who is wholeheartedly throwing himself into the music with exuberance, eventually collapsing onto his back in a dramatic display. Meanwhile, Jane playfully spins Graham's legs like a wheel, adding to the fun, as the joyful celebration continues in high spirits.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rebecca eagerly accepts the bouquet handed to her and quickly scurries after the other maids of honor. Her heart races as she watches Suze’s father move forward to take his daughter's arm, preparing to walk her down the aisle. In a sudden burst of joyous energy, Rebecca pivots and collides gently with Suze, enveloping her in a warm embrace. With a beaming smile, Rebecca pulls away and races down the aisle, her dress fluttering as she moves swiftly to catch up with the other three bridesmaids, who are gracefully processing towards the altar. Meanwhile, Suze, her black hair styled in a sophisticated bun, gathers herself, taking a deep breath as she focuses her gaze on the altar where Tarquin awaits, his face radiant with a loving smile. After the ceremony concludes, guests, including Rebecca, joyously wave goodbye as Suze and Tarquin, now newlyweds, are whisked away in a gleaming white Rolls Royce. Rebecca stands amidst the elegantly dressed crowd, her spotted shrug contrasting with the attire around her, her expression soft with affection. However, as people gradually start to leave, Rebecca's expression shifts subtly, as if a wave of melancholy and contemplation has washed over her, mingling with thoughts of happiness. Turning away from the church, she steps decisively onto the city street, her movements somewhat weighed down by the voluminous tulle petticoat beneath her pink bridesmaid dress and the long white gloves adorning her arms. Her path takes her by the window of Yves St. Laurent where she momentarily pauses, captivated by a black China mannequin within, which taps delicately on the glass to grab her attention. Rebecca lifts her dress's hem slightly and ponders, as another mannequin playfully taps and reveals the orange bag she's holding. Rebecca's gaze flits between her own pink bag and the mannequin's orange one, which is being jiggled enticingly in her direction. Her eyes brighten with awe, and a smile tugs at her lips, but with a small, resolute shake of her head, she decides to move on. As she continues past the fashion windows, a series of mannequins applaud her with silent, exaggerated gestures, prompting a bubble of laughter from her. Rebecca spins her skirt around with a playful swing, her joy palpable, but she halts abruptly as she catches sight of Luke standing in front of her on the crowded pavement. Looking up at him, her expression is one of sheepishness, much like a child caught in a mischievous act. Yet, with a simple shrug, she steps closer to him, and he mirrors her movement; they find themselves directly in front of Asprey's. Rebecca shakes her head in a gesture of helplessness, meeting Luke's penetrating gaze, which softens with the hint of a smile. Reaching smoothly into his coat pocket, Luke retrieves a green scarf and tenderly wraps it around her neck. In response, Rebecca's face lights up with a brilliant smile, and she leans into him, welcoming his tender kiss. As their lips meet, Rebecca's peripheral vision catches the placement of a new pair of ankle boots in a nearby window display, along with a tall mannequin tilting her head and giving a playful wink. Rebecca returns her full attention to Luke, her grin unwavering as she sinks into the moment. The screen slowly fades to black, leaving only the vibrant green of the scarf as a lingering memory. Later, when introducing Alicia to Janne, Rebecca steps back to watch as Janne gallantly kisses Alicia's hand. She then delights in a dance with Luke, her movements carefree and fluid. Not far off, Luke notices Graham, who entertainingly throws himself into the music with abandon, lying on his back as Jane humorously rotates his legs like a wheel, adding to the lively and joyful atmosphere.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rebecca is handed a bouquet and follows the other maids of honor as Suze's father takes his daughter's arm. She embraces Suze with a grin, then joins the bridesmaids walking down the aisle. Suze, maintaining poise, looks towards Tarquin at the altar. After the wedding, the guests, including Rebecca in her spotted shrug, bid farewell to the newlyweds departing in a white Rolls Royce. As the crowd disperses, Rebecca's expression shifts to introspection, and she crosses a city street in her pink bridesmaid dress. Passing an Yves St. Laurent window, she examines her pink bag, tempted by the mannequins showing off an orange one. Delighted by the mannequins' applause, she laughs and twirls her skirt but pauses upon seeing Luke. They approach each other, and he wraps a green scarf around her neck, eliciting her beaming smile before they kiss. As they embrace, Rebecca notices ankle boots in a window and a mannequin winking at her, but she redirects her attention to Luke as the scene fades to black. Subsequently, she introduces Alicia to Janne, who greets Alicia with a kiss on the hand before dancing with Luke. Meanwhile, Luke observes Graham playfully dancing, with Jane turning Graham's legs like a wheel.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Rebecca is handed a bouquet, the floral arrangement traditionally symbolizing good luck and happiness, and hurries after the other maids of honor as Suze's father, a respected local businessman known for his generosity in the community, goes to take his daughter's arm. Rebecca turns around and runs into Suze's open arms. Suze, with her black hair pinned up in an elegant bun, a hairstyle often chosen for formal events due to its timeless grace, composes herself and looks towards the altar at Tarquin's smiling face, her soon-to-be husband who comes from a long line of musicians. After the wedding, Rebecca and the rest of the guests wave as the newlyweds are driven off in a white Rolls Royce, a luxurious vehicle often associated with elegance and wealth. Rebecca, standing among the well-dressed crowd in her spotted shrug made by a renowned local designer, smiles fondly. As people begin to disperse, her face starts to cloud over, as if suddenly thinking of something sad and serious along with the good things. She turns away from the historic 19th-century church and starts walking across a city street in her pink bridesmaid dress, with a heavy tulle petticoat for added volume and long, white gloves traditionally worn for ceremony elegance. She walks past the window of Yves St. Laurent, a famed fashion house known for high fashion and luxury goods, where a black China mannequin, designed by a prominent artist known for avant-garde window displays, knocks on the window. Rebecca lifts the hem of her pink dress and considers, as a second mannequin knocks on the glass and shows her the orange bag she's carrying, likely a limited-edition piece from the latest collection. Rebecca compares it to her pink one, and the mannequin jiggles the bag seductively, almost as if marketing the allure of high fashion. Rebecca's eyes fill with wonder, and she smiles eagerly, but then, with a little shake of the head, she walks on. The two doll-like mannequins look at each other; the seated one with the bag stands up, and both clap their hands. The mannequins in all the fashion windows she passes applaud her, cleverly animated by hidden mechanics to engage passersby, and Rebecca starts to laugh, swinging her skirt joyfully, then stops in her tracks. Luke, her long-time friend known for his quick wit and charm, is standing in front of her in the middle of the pavement. She looks at him like a kid who's been caught stealing sweets from a candy store and shrugs inanely. She steps towards him, and he steps towards her; they're in front of Asprey's, an iconic British jeweler and luxury goods brand. She shakes her head hopelessly as he looks intently into her face, and a faint smile flickers across his lips. Reaching into his coat pocket, he brings out the green scarf, a soft cashmere piece she had admired months before, and wraps it around her neck. Rebecca beams at him, and he kisses her on the lips. As they kiss, a pair of ankle boots made of fine Italian leather is placed in a window display, and Rebecca spots them in the corner of her eye as a tall, white-faced mannequin tilts her head and winks at her, an interactive feature designed to captivate the audience. Rebecca grins and goes back to giving Luke's kiss her full attention as the screen fades to black, leaving just the green scarf, highlighting the moment's significance. She introduces Alicia, a rising star in the art world, to Janne, who kisses Alicia's hand, following the elegant customs of a bygone era, and then dances with Luke. Luke spots Graham, a notorious party enthusiast, throwing himself about to the music, where Graham lies on his back and Jane turns his legs like a wheel, a playful move often seen at local dance events.

As people begin to disperse her face starts to cloud over as if suddenly thinking of something sad and serious along with the good things. She turns away from the church and starts walking across a city street in her pink bridesmaid dress with a heavy tulle petticoat and long white gloves. She walks past the window of Yves St Laurent where a black China mannequin knocks on the window. Rebecca lifts the hem of her pink dress and considers as a second mannequin knocks on the glass and shows her the orange bag she is carrying. Rebecca compares it to her pink one and the mannequin jiggles the bag seductively. Rebecca's eyes fill with wonder and she smiles eagerly but then with a little shake of the head she walks on. The two dolllike mannequins look at each other. the seated one with the bag stands up and both clap their hands. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. The mannequins in all the fashion windows. she passes applaud her and Rebecca starts to laugh swinging her skirt joyfully then stops in her tracks. Luke is standing in front of her in the middle of the pavement. She looks at him like a kid who is been caught stealing sweets and shrugs inanely. She steps towards him and he steps towards her. they are in front of Asprey's. She shakes her head hopelessly as he looks intently into her face and a faint smile flickers across his lips. Reaching into his coat pocket he brings out the green scarf and wraps it around her neck. Rebecca beams at him and he kisses her on the lips. As they kiss a pair of ankle boots is placed in a window display and Rebecca spots them in the corner of her eye as a tall whitefaced mannequin tilts her head and winks at her. Rebecca grins and goes back to giving Luke's kiss her full attention as the screen fades to black leaving just the green scarf. She introduces Alicia to Janne who kisses Alicia's hand and then dances with Luke. Luke spots Graham throwing himself about to the music where Graham lies on his back and Jane turns his legs like a wheel.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Stanley is tossed a frisbee and ambles after the other mechanics as Harold's uncle strolls to catch his son's leg. Stanley spins around and leaps into Harold's extended paws, chuckling softly as he gallops down the path to join the other two lifeguards who are creeping slowly towards the bonfire. Harold, with his golden locks tied up in a casual ponytail, steadies himself and peers towards the bonfire at Marvin's giggling grin. After the festival, Stanley and the rest of the onlookers cheer as the champions are flown away in a red hot air balloon. Stanley, standing among the brightly-clad crowd in his striped poncho, grins warmly. As individuals begin to scatter, his expression starts to darken, as if suddenly pondering something gloomy and peculiar along with the cheerful moments. He turns away from the meadow and starts strolling across a village lane in his blue lifeguard uniform, with a fluffy feathered cap and large, black mittens. He strides past the doorway of Giorgio Armani where a green clay sculpture taps on the door. Stanley lifts the cuff of his blue uniform and ponders, as a second sculpture thumps on the doorframe and reveals the purple hat she's donning. Stanley compares it to his blue one, and the sculpture waves the hat playfully. Stanley's eyes fill with curiosity, and he chuckles eagerly, but then, with a tiny shrug of the shoulders, he moves along. The two statue-like sculptures glance at each other; the seated one with the hat rises, and both slap the table. The sculptures in all the gallery doorways he passes cheer for him, and Stanley starts to giggle, twirling his cap joyfully, then halts in his path. Charlie is standing before him in the center of the sidewalk. He peers at him like a puppy who's been caught chewing slippers and shrugs sheepishly. He steps towards him, and he steps towards him; they're near Tiffany's. He shakes his head sadly as he gazes deeply into his gaze, and a gentle grin dances across his mouth. Reaching into his jacket pocket, he pulls out the yellow bandana and drapes it around his shoulder. Stanley glows at him, and he hugs him tight. As they hug, a pair of sneakers is set in a storefront, and Stanley glimpses them from the corner of his eye as a short, green-headed sculpture tilts her face and nods at him. Stanley giggles and returns to giving Charlie's hug his undivided focus as the scene fades to white, leaving just the yellow bandana. He introduces Belinda to Oscar, who pats Belinda's arm, and then skips with Charlie. Charlie notices Peter spinning himself around to the tune, where Peter lies on his belly and Lucy rotates his arms like a fan.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Rebecca receives a bouquet and joins the other bridesmaids, excitedly running down the aisle as Suze prepares to marry Tarquin. After the ceremony, the guests wave the newlyweds off in a Rolls Royce. As Rebecca ponders both happy and sad thoughts, she crosses a street in her pink bridesmaid dress. Passing a window display, she notices mannequins knocking on the glass and showcasing bags, but she moves on, amused. The mannequins applaud her as she walks, and she laughs until she sees Luke standing in front of her. They share a warm moment as he wraps a green scarf around her neck and kisses her. Rebecca momentarily notices more mannequins and boots in the window but returns to their kiss. The scene fades with just the green scarf visible. Later, she introduces Alicia to Janne and dances with Luke, while Graham theatrically dances nearby.
